boardgame.name: Being Dead
boardgame.description:
From the description:

a guide to being undead/already dead in the world of MÖRK BORG featuring:

daily effects of being undead
how to be undead
the perks of being a zombie
ideas for how to become undead

it's just a page with a table and some nice bullet points, but what more do you need?

boardgame.name: Vulgar Stenches
boardgame.description:
From the description:

d12 horrific odors you may encounter, and their deleterious effects on your constitution

boardgame.name: Crawfolk
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Crawfolk are an aquatic species and class for fantasy tabletop roleplaying games, designed for use with Old-School Essentials. Crawfolk are sapient crustaceans who make use of mud magic. A class description, advanced species description, and sample monster stat block are included.

boardgame.name: Judgment in the Lower Courts
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A two-page, Kafkaesque dungeon for dungeon-crawling TTRPGs inspired by Franz Kafka's The Trial.

The PCs have been charged with a crime. Which crime? They'll never know. It is not important that the facts come to light or that justice is done. The important thing is that the process is carried out. One must uphold the law.

boardgame.name: Alive! Entertainments
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A toy store adventure for fantasy RPGs. This adventure is system agnostic and should be compatible with most fantasy RPGs.

It contains:

- Dolls that come to life!
- A dark mystery
- 26 keyed locations
- Maps
- Original magic items
- Fiendish puzzles
- Supplements and player handouts for all of its unique elements
- A "control panel" layout that lets you run the adventure with minimal page-flipping

boardgame.name: Exiled Vodnic
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Inspired by slavic folklore, monstrous race-as-class designed for use with Old Schoool Essentials.

boardgame.name: Amazing Adventures: StarSiege
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Worlds upon worlds beckon you….

Beyond the next horizon lies the uncharted future where science and fiction meet, a line beyond which lies a stellar wilderness defined only by our own imagination. Countless worlds upon worlds await in that vast black void, worlds of swords and sorcery, super science and cyberpunk netrunning, quantum mechanics, light speed engines and laser swords.

Gigantic powered mechs and giant kaiju battle on the ground while starships roar through nebulae in a desperate attempt to take down evil galactic empires while giant generation ships explore the unmapped regions of deep space, contacting new intelligences and seeking only to find a home among the stars…

This is StarSIEGE.

StarSIEGE is a sourcebook for the Amazing Adventures role playing game, and is equally compatible with Castles & Crusades and other SIEGE Engine games. Within its pages you will find:


Alien races and sci-fi character classes
Rules for computer hacking and cyberpunk netrunning
Rules for Kaiju monsters and battle mechs
Optional skill packages and rules for creating sci-fi equipment
Stats for laser and plasma guns, laser swords and other gear
Starship rules and statistics
Solar Burn, a complete futuristic campaign setting that combines space opera with cyberpunk and the backdrop of an interstellar war
The gateway to taking your SIEGE Engine games to the stars and beyond
And so much more!


This is the book you've waited for. The SIEGE Engine goes Galactic. Have you got what it takes?

boardgame.name: Slayer Codex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Intelligent Melee Fighters and Deadly Ranged Combatants

Do your PCs need to hire a tracker that can deal serious damage? Does your upcoming session need someone that can bring the pain to the toughest members of the group utilizing unexpected tricks? Are you seeking ideas for the terrible power at the end of your campaign? The Book of Beasts: Slayer Codex has the solutions you need, arming Game Masters of the First Edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game with the following:


20 ready-made slayer characters, one for each level of play


Tactical combat recommendations for every character, helping you to quickly and effectively run the NPC in a fight

Personalities and details to give you ideas on how to use the characters both in combat and in roleplaying interactions

boardgame.name: Journey's Edge
boardgame.description:
It was a bad wreck, yet somehow, you survived. You don't remember what happened, or how, but something went terribly wrong aboard that cursed vessel. Now you must begin the incredible journey that lies ahead, mustering every ounce of strength and willpower you have left, with one goal in mind ... staying alive.

Players travel a modular tile map to reveal uncharted areas, acquire resources, and build necessary items needed to outlast nature's harshest elements. Over the course of eight rounds, an event-driven scenario containing mission-critical objectives force players to wisely manage their precious inventories and prized possessions. These objectives must be completed by the end of the eighth round in order for players to be victorious.

Journey's Edge features strictly strategic gameplay, with hardly any luck (or dice). At each player's disposal is a deck of action cards that are used to move their character across the board to gather food, wood, stone, and fur, which can then be spent to create items like clothing and shelter. They must manage these limited resources carefully and work together as a team to determine the best course of action. To succeed, no one can be left behind.

Discover enchanted locations. Gather valuable resources. Craft useful tools and weapons. Encounter deadly creatures and monsters, and uncover magical artifacts that will assist you in your quest at Journey's Edge. Odds are against you, but perhaps your fate is not sealed. As part of a team of seasoned expeditionists, you know what must be done. The question is, will it be enough to ensure your survival?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Magus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Character Options series brings you fresh, new options for a single character class. In this installment, we focus on the Magus!

In this document we start out with three new archetypes to use for your magus characters; the Dragon Champion, the Shadow Magus, and the Spellfist. There is also a selection of new magus arcana, some exclusive to the three new archetypes and others usable by any magus. Finally, we present a list of new spells and new feats to expand the repertoire of any magus or other arcane caster.

boardgame.name: Roll With It! Books
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll With It! Books is a pay-what-you-want product that is intended to be a quick way for game masters to generate unique book descriptions on a moments notice.

boardgame.name: Roll With It! Potions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll With It! Potions is a pay-what-you-want product that is intended to be a quick way for game masters to generate unique potion descriptions on a moments notice.

boardgame.name: Roll With It! Ship Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll With It! Ship Names is a pay-what-you-want product that is intended to be a quick way for game masters to generate unique ship names on a moments notice.

boardgame.name: Roll With It! Tavern Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll With It! Tavern Names is a pay-what-you-want product that is intended to be a quick way for game masters to generate unique tavern names on a moments notice.

boardgame.name: Roll With It! Villager Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll With It! Villager Names is a pay-what-you-want product that is intended to be a quick way for game masters to generate unique names for villagers on a moments notice.

boardgame.name: Roll With It! Wands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll With It! Wands is a pay-what-you-want product that is intended to be a quick way for game masters to generate unique wand descriptions on a moments notice.

boardgame.name: Roll With It! Western Towns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll With It! Western Towns is a pay-what-you-want product that is intended to be a quick way for game masters to generate unique western town names at a moment's notice.

boardgame.name: Emissary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Master of Diplomacy

The emissary is an all-new class for Pathfinder Second Edition, melding the magic of arcane empires with the supportive skill of a trained ambassador. With five imperial origins from the knightly abjurant crusade with their bulky tornswords and defensive acumen to the fiery sands of flame with their regal war scepters and burning light, the emissary can master the social graces like no other. With more than 40 class feats from levels 1-20 like Catspaw Assault and Animal Sidekick, no two emissaries are the same! Whether braggadocious or cunning, a merciless intimidator or a gregarious gadabout, any emissary can brand their foes with their empire's mark, setting them up so their allies can lay them low. Plus, find the emissary multiclass archetype to splash some imperial graces into other classes, and several new mundane weapons used by those far-off empires.

boardgame.name: Oh My, Khosht!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh My, Khosht! - it's a mini solo and two gm adventures for Monsters! Monsters!

This brand new mini-solo pits the new bat-trolls against the patrons of the Ruptured Troll Inn, a dive bar in Khosht near the docks. Will you be able to help the monsters? And if so - which ones will you help? You can play one of the well-known patrons from the bar, or create your own monster to adventure in this mini-solo by Ken St Andre.

We are also including the rare bonus pages from the Monsters! Monsters Hardcover edition, with Ken St Andre's Murder at the Ruptured Troll short story, along with the character stats and maps of the Inn, plus scenario suggestions so you can run GM adventures at the Ruptured Troll and in Khosht.

PLUS you get the short Bat-Troll gm adventure by Steve Crompton, the M!M! Character sheets (both versions) chracter portraits and some bonus art. 32 pages with art by Steve Crompton and Phil Longmeirer.

boardgame.name: Les Contes des 1001 tuiles
Tiles of the Arabian Nights
boardgame.description:
Tiles of the Arabian Nights is set in the universe of the Arabian Nights. In Bagdad, storytelling has become deeply ingrained in the city’s culture ever since the legendary Scheherazade told 1001 unforgettable tales over as many nights. In honor of the queen, the Sultan now holds a storytelling contest each year!

This year, as a citizen of Bagdad, you’re taking part in the contest, in the hopes of winning the title of Master Storyteller. But coming up with a good story isn’t easy, and as every tale contains at least a grain of truth, you find yourself in search of a little inspiration…

So get ready to head out into the desert in search of adventure! As you explore, you’ll meet colorful characters, find amazing treasures, and defeat fearsome foes. Each new discovery you make will earn you an Adventure tile. Once you’ve collected enough tiles for your story, you’ll return to Bagdad to tell it to the awaiting crowds.

Exactly what your story will be is up to you…

Use the beautiful, unique illustrations on your tiles as inspiration to come up with a story worthy of the Arabian Nights! Each tale you tell will earn you points from the Sultan himself, and from other players. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Deluxe Wooden token set
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Legends of the Sand

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: The Wolf & The Rat
boardgame.description:
The Wolf & The Rat is an expansion for Vampire: The Masquerade Rivals that adds two new clans: GANGREL & NOSFERATU. Connected through animalism, but divided by opposing loyalties, the Gangrel and Nosferatu provide ample opportunity to unleash the beast within and explore the more feral side of their clan’s animal nature. You may play these two clans head-to-head with the pre-constructed decks provided, or integrate them with your Core Set and other expansions to create unique strategies for conquering your foes!

Features:

Adds two new clans: GANGREL & NOSFERATU
Play these two clans head-to-head or integrate them with your Core Set.
Includes a 30 card Crypt Pack to customize your decks!
Designed for 2-4 players, ages 14+ to play in 30-70 min per game.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals Expandable Card Game

boardgame.name: The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Zine (2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For many roleplayers around the world, the 5th Edition of the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game has been their introduction to fantastic worlds of imagination, adventure, and discovery. With so many more tabletop roleplaying games out there waiting to be discovered, what if we taught you how these games work by hacking them into 5e?

The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Zine published four issues revealing ways to merge some of the most exciting indie tabletop RPGs with 5e. This compilation contains over 80 pages of original articles that will introduce your heroes to narrative dice, dungeon clocks, complications, alternate death rules, new backgrounds to convert your characters into high school heroes and much, much more.
boardgame.rpgissue: The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Zine

boardgame.name: The Kingdom of Grimsby: Bremen Town-Musicians
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a Kingdom far away, there were once a group of animals who were on their way to Bremen to become musicians…

The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town is the second adventure set in the Kingdom of Grimsby where all of the characters are inspired by Tales of the Brothers Grimm. The adventure locations and player characters are based on The Robber Bridegroom, The Bremen Town-Musicians, The Donkey, The Fox and the Cat, The Beam, and The Owl. The map of the cabin is included as an extra JPG file with the PDF. (See instructions below to load into Roll20!)

The unlikely companions--Donkey, Hound, Cat, Rooster, Giant Owl, and Raven--had all left their unhappy homes are are on their own, when they are backed into a cabin the woods only to discover the occupants are up to no good. Together they meet a few new NPCs and have the chance to rid the kingdom of a group of smugglers/murderers.

The adventure runs about 5-7 hours, and is written for up to 6 players playing level 6.

boardgame.name: The Kingdom of Grimsby: Snow White
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you want to live in a faerie tale? Be careful what you wish for…

The Kingdom of Grimsby Snow White is the first adventure set in the Kingdom of Grimsby where all of the characters are inspired by Tales of the Brothers Grimm (more to come!) -- Snow White; One-Eye, Two-Eyes, & Three-Eyes; and guest appearences from Hansel & Gretel.

Three hags were banished from the kingdom, and now they are now back to get their revenge on the entire kingdom and its royal families!

The players are a dwarven mining team who are caught in the middle finding themselves on an adventure to save their missing friend. This leads them on a path to saving the entire kingdom and the royal family. They travel from the Village of Hameln, into the Enchanted Forest, teleporting into the Feywild, and ending at the Castle of Grimsby in the heart of the City of Grimsby. Along the way, they encounter new creatures, allies, and enemies.

The adventure runs 8-12 sessions (25-40 hours) and is written for 3-6 players playing levels 3-5.

boardgame.name: Phoenix Sorcerer Sorcerer Subclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you want a sorcerer who has gained its powers from rising again from fire & ashes? Choose the the Phoenix Sorcerer subclass for your next adventure!

This is featured in The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town-Musicians, but can also be used in any 5e adventure on its own.

Subclass Description: Your magical powers come from your brief stint with death and you have risen out of the flames and ashes more powerful than before.

Included Features:

Phoenix's Power Spells
Death Sense
Phoenix's Protection
Phoenix Rises
Escape danger

boardgame.name: Way of the Whiskers Monk Subclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you inspired by fierce felines? Choose the Way of the Whiskers Monk subclass for your next adventure!

This is featured in The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town-Musicians, but can also be used in any 5e adventure on its own.

Subclass Description: You have harnessed the grace, agility, and cunning of the feline. Cats are playful and quick, and have learned to be fierce little hunters.

Included Features:

Feline Senses
Feline Pounce
Feline Fear
Nine Lives
Cat's Claws

boardgame.name: Beast Domain Cleric Subclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you channel your divinity from Mother Nature or the Beasts in the Wild? Choose the Beast Domain subclass for your next adventure!

This is featured in The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town-Musicians, but can also be used in any 5e adventure on its own.

Subclass Description: These are clerics who are close to nature and the beasts who live there, and you channel your divinity from a connection with Mother Nature. This gives you the abilities of the beasts who live in nature in addition to typical cleric abilities.

Included Features:

Beast Domain Spells
Expertise Skill
Channel Divinity: Animal Instincts
Fightening Ally
Beastly Attacks
Nature Spellcasting

boardgame.name: Flock College Bard Subclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you protective over your allies? Choose the Flock College Bard subclass for your next adventure!

This is featured in The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town-Musicians, but can also be used in any 5e adventure on its own.

Subclass Description: You are protective of your allies and flock and your studies taught you how to take care of them and watch over them. Others look to you as a leader and protector.

Included Features:

Armor Proficiency
Flock Protector
Saving Throw Proficiency
Inspired Flock

boardgame.name: Path of the Unicorn Barbarian Subclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you inspired by the majestic Unicorn? Choose the Path of the Unicorn Barbarian subclass for your next adventure!

This is featured in The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town-Musicians, but can also be used in any 5e adventure on its own.

Subclass Description: You are inspired by the majestic beauty of the Unicorn, and have chosen the Path of the Unicorn to mimic its healing and protective features. In addition to your tough barbarian features, you will gain a magical horn attack while raging, the ability to avoid some conditions, heal your fellow adventurers, and protect them from harm.

Included Features:

Unicorn Horn Attack
Unicorn's Calm
Unicorn's Healing Touch
Shimmering Shield

boardgame.name: Wizard's Apprentice Wizard Subclass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a wizard who is just starting to practice your arcane skills in the real world? Choose the Wizard's Apprentice Wizard subclass for your next adventure!

This is featured in The Kingdom of Grimsby Bremen Town-Musicians, but can also be used in any 5e adventure on its own.

Subclass Description: You have learned the arcane arts from one of the best wizards, and now you are on your own to practice and expand on what you've learned out in the real world.

Included Features:

Teacher's Pet
Beginner's Spellcasting
Duck and Cover
Controlled Spellcasting
Advanced Spellcasting
